question: Which alternative is the best explanation of the action of detergents?

answers.A: The intermolecular bonding capabilities of a detergent molecule are due to the hydrogen atoms within the molecule.
answers.B: The length of a detergent molecule enables its overall polarity.
answers.C: The hydrophillic nature of a detergent molecule allows it to break up grease and fats.
answers.D: One end of the detergent molecule is polar while the other end is non-polar.
